element.short: CheckEnabled - whether a given (indexed) entry in the list is allowed to be checked.

descr.p: CheckEnabled is an indexed Boolean property used to maintain the Enabled property for the check box at the position specified in Index. Index contains the ordinal position in the list of check boxes for the control, and must be in the range 0..Items.Count-1. An exception is raised when Index is not within the required range.
Use the Checked property to determine if a check box has its Checked property set to True.
Use Items to maintain the Captions for the check boxes displayed in the grouped edit control.

element.name: TCustomCheckGroup.CheckEnabled.Index
element.short: Ordinal position for the check box examined in the method.

element.name: TCustomCheckGroup.Columns
element.short: Columns is the number of columns in which the Items (check boxes) are arranged.

descr.p: Columns is an Integer property which specifies the number of columns used to display the check boxes for the grouped edit control. Changing the value in the property causes the UpdateControlsPerLine method to be called. The new value for the property must be a positive non-zero value or an exception is raised.
The value in Columns is used as the number of controls displayed per line in the ChildSizing property.
The default value for the property is 1.

element.name: TCustomCheckGroup.ColumnLayout
element.short: ColumnLayout HorizontalThenVertical or vice versa.

descr.p: ColumnLayout is a TColumnLayout property which specifies the layout strategy used when rendering the Items in the grouped edit control. The default value for the property is clHorizontalThenVertical, and causes check boxes to be drawn horizontally for the required number of Columns before advancing.
Assigning a new value for the property causes ChildSizing to be updated to use the corresponding value in its Layout property.

element.name: TCustomCheckGroup.OnItemClick
element.short: OnItemClick - event handler signalled when the mouse is clicked on one of the Items in the control.

descr.p: OnItemClick is a TCheckGroupClicked property used as the event handler signalled when a check box is clicked for the grouped edit control. Applications must implement and assign an object procedure using the signature in TCheckGroupClicked to respond to the input event.

element.name: TCheckGroup
element.short: TCheckGroup is a group of Check Boxes physically and logically grouped together on a form.

descr.p: TCheckGroup is a group of Check Boxes physically and logically grouped together on a form.

To use this control, place it in the required position on the form, then either right-click on the control to see the pop-up CheckGroup editor, or in the Object Inspector select Items and click on the ellipsis (...) to open the string editor. In either case, type in the captions to accompany each check box, then close the string or CheckGroup editor and you will see a series of boxes with their captions displayed beside them.
Inherits properties from TCustomCheckGroup and TCustomGroupBox.

element.name: TCheckGroup.Caption
element.short: String which appears at the top of the grouped edit control.

descr.p: Caption is the string which appears as a caption at the top of the grouped edit control to describe the function of the Check Group as a whole.

element.name: TCheckGroup.Items
element.short: Items - a string list containing the captions of the check boxes.

descr.p: Items is a string list containing the captions for the check boxes displayed in the grouped edit control.
Use the String List editor or the CheckGroup editor (opened by right-clicking on the control in the Form) to insert the captions for the check boxes, and determine their order and layout.

element.name: TBoundLabel
element.short: Implements a label bound to another control.

descr.p: TBoundLabel is a TCustomLabel descendant which implements a label bound to another control. TBoundLabel is the type used to implement the EditLabel property in TCustomLabeledEdit and TLabeledEdit.
Use Caption to assign the text displayed in the label. Use Layout to specify the text alignment used for the Caption value.

The FocusControl property specifies the control given focus when a Dialog accelerator key or other input event in the class is handled. Use one of the AnchorSide* properties to specify the edge anchored to the FocusControl.
Other than a constructor, the class does not have any new methods or event handlers.

element.name: TBoundLabel.Create
element.short: Constructor for the class instance.
element.descr: Create is the constructor for TBoundLabel. It calls the inherited Create method, and makes itself a SubComponent of the Owner. The Caption in the control is changed to the Name in the Owner.

element.name: TBoundLabel.Create.TheOwner
element.short: Owner for the class instance.

element.name: TBoundLabel.FocusControl
element.short: FocusControl is the control to receive focus when the label is activated.

descr.p: FocusControl also receives key messages in the DialogChar method.

element.name: TLabelPosition
element.short: TLabelPosition is an enumerated type with values that represent the position of a label relative to an associated control: i. e. above, below, left, or right.

element.name: TCustomLabeledEdit
element.short: Custom Labelled Edit.

descr.p: TCustomLabeledEdit : The base type for LabeledEdit.
Note particularly the EditLabel property (see TBoundLabel), which contains the label attached to the Edit control.

element.name: TCustomLabeledEdit.SetLabelPosition
element.short: Sets the value for the LabelPosition property.

element.name: TCustomLabeledEdit.SetLabelPosition.Value
element.short: New value for the property.

element.name: TCustomLabeledEdit.SetLabelSpacing
element.short: Sets the value for the LabelSpacing property.

element.name: TCustomLabeledEdit.SetLabelSpacing.Value
element.short: New value for the property.

element.name: TCustomLabeledEdit.SetParent
element.short: Sets the value for the Parent property.

descr.p: SetParent is overridden in TCustomLabeledEdit to ensure that the EditLabel for the control is properly aligned after the value in Parent is changed. Calls DoPositionLabel to set the label visibility and position the label using the value in LabelPosition and LabelSpacing.

element.name: TCustomLabeledEdit.SetParent.AParent
element.short: New parent for the control.

descr.p: SetName is overridden in TCustomLabeledEdit to assign the new value for the property to the Caption in EditLabel at design-time. SetName calls the inherited method prior to exit.

element.name: TCustomLabeledEdit.SetName.Value
element.short: New value for the property.

element.name: TCustomLabeledEdit.Loaded
element.short: Performs actions needed when the component has finished loading in the LCL streaming mechanism.

descr.p: Loaded is overridden in TCustomLabeledEdit to position the EditLabel by calling the DoPositionLabel method. Loaded calls the inherited method.

element.name: TCustomLabeledEdit.DoPositionLabel
element.short: DoPositionLabel - perform the code for positioning the label.

descr.p: DoPositionLabel is a procedure used to place the EditLabel relative to the companion control. No actions are performed in the method when EditLabel is unassigned (contains Nil).
DoPositionLabel ensures that DisableAlign is called in the Parent control (when assigned). EnableAlign is called for the Parent control prior to exiting from the method.

DoPositionLabel updates EditLabel to use the values assigned to the Parent and Visibility properties. The values in LabelPosition and LabelSpacing are used to determine the anchoring to the companion control applied to EditLabel.

element.name: TCustomLabeledEdit.Notification
element.short: Handles a notification when a component is added to or removed from the control.

descr.p: Notification is overridden in TCustomLabeledEdit to ensure that a reference to the EditLabel property is released when Operation contains the value opRemove. Notification calls the inherited method.

element.name: TCustomLabeledEdit.Notification.AComponent
element.short: Component for the event notification.

element.name: TCustomLabeledEdit.Notification.Operation
element.short: Operation for the event notification.

element.name: TCustomLabeledEdit.CMBiDiModeChanged
element.short: Handles the CM_BIDIMODECHANGED control message for the control.

descr.p: Ensures that an assigned EditLabel uses the value stored in the BiDiMode property. Calls DoPositionLabel to update the control layout and position, and calls Invalidate to force the control to be redrawn.
Calls the inherited CMBiDiModeChanged method.

element.name: TCustomLabeledEdit.CMBiDiModeChanged.Msg
element.short: Message handled in the method.

element.name: TCustomLabeledEdit.CreateInternalLabel
element.short: CreateInternalLabel - method for internally creating label.

descr.p: CreateInternalLabel is a method used to allocate resources for the EditLabel property in the class instance. TCustomLabeledEdit creates the TBoundLabel class instance used in EditLabel, and updates its ControlStyle property to prevent selection at design-time (csNoDesignSelectable). The current class instance is used as the FocusControl in EditLabel.
No actions are performed in the method if EditLabel has already been assigned in the class instance.
CreateInternalLabel is used in the implementation of the Create constructor.

element.name: TCustomLabeledEdit.Create
element.short: Create - constructor for TCustomLabeledEdit: calls inherited Create then sets initial position and label spacing.

element.name: TCustomLabeledEdit.Create.TheOwner
element.short: Owner of the class instance.

element.name: TCustomLabeledEdit.EditLabel
element.short: EditLabel - the label attached to the edit box.

element.name: TCustomLabeledEdit.LabelPosition
element.short: LabelPosition - whether above, below, to the left or to the right of the Edit box.

element.name: TCustomLabeledEdit.LabelSpacing
element.short: LabelSpacing - the distance between the Label and the Edit box.

element.name: TLabeledEdit
element.short: Labelled Edit is an Edit Box with a permanently attached Label.

descr.p: TLabeledEditis an Edit Box with a permanently attached Label.
Saves time and effort over placing separate Label and Edit Box on Form. The properties are described in the parent component, TCustomLabeledEdit from which most of the properties are inherited.
TPanelBevel is an alias to the TBevelCut type. TPanelBevel is the type used to implement the BevelInner and BevelOuter properties in TCustomPanel.

element.name: TCustomPanel
element.short: The base class for a general container which can hold other objects. It has a customizable border and a central text.

descr.p: TCustomPanelis the base type for TPanel.

A Panel is a defined rectangular area on a form into which other components can be placed to group them functionally and geographically. TCustomPanel defines the positioning and beveling properties of any descendent classes, and provides methods for painting and writing text to the panel.

element.name: TCustomPanel.PaintBevel
element.short: Draws a bevel using the color and width defined for the panel.

descr.p: PaintBevel is a procedure used to draw the bevel for the panel using the values in the BevelColor and BevelWidth properties. ARect is the rectangle with the coordinates where the bevel is drawn. ABevel contains the style used to draw the bevel.
descr.remark: Please note: No actions are performed in the method when ABevel contains the value bvNone.
descr.p: PaintBevel uses the Canvas for the control as the target for the drawing operation. The Frame3D method in the Canvas is used to draw the bevel with the required color, width, and style for the panel.
PaintBevel is used in the implementation of the Paint method to draw using both the BevelInner and BevelOuter styles.

element.name: TCustomPanel.SetAlignment
element.short: Sets the value for the Alignment property.

element.name: TCustomPanel.SetAlignment.Value
element.short: New value for the property.

element.name: TCustomPanel.SetBevelColor
element.short: Sets the value for the BevelColor property.

element.name: TCustomPanel.SetBevelColor.AColor
element.short: New value for the property.

element.name: TCustomPanel.SetBevelInner
element.short: Sets the value for the BevelInner property.

element.name: TCustomPanel.SetBevelInner.Value
element.short: New value for the property.

element.name: TCustomPanel.SetBevelOuter
element.short: Sets the value for the BevelOuter property.

element.name: TCustomPanel.SetBevelOuter.Value
element.short: New value for the property.

element.name: TCustomPanel.SetBevelWidth
element.short: Sets the value for the BevelWidth property.

element.name: TCustomPanel.SetBevelWidth.Value
element.short: New value for the property.

element.name: TCustomPanel.SetWordWrap
element.short: Sets the value for the WordWrap property.

element.name: TCustomPanel.SetWordWrap.Value
element.short: New value for the property.

element.name: TCustomPanel.AdjustClientRect
element.short: Adjusts the specified rectangle to account for border and bevels used in the control.

descr.p: AdjustClientRect is an overridden procedure used to adjust the drawing rectangle in ARect to account for borders and bevels used on the panel. AdjustClientRect calls the inherited method, and calculates the number of pixels required for the settings in BorderWidth, BeveInner, and BevelOuter. AdjustClientRect calls InflateRect to adjust ARect by the calcluated border and bevel widths.
AdjustClientRect is called when the control is autosize or aligned.

element.name: TCustomPanel.AdjustClientRect.Rect
element.short: Drawing rectangle adjusted in the method.

element.name: TCustomPanel.GetControlClassDefaultSize
element.short: Gets the size used for new instance of the class type.

descr.p: GetControlClassDefaultSize is overridden to provide the default size for new instances of the class type. The return value is a TSize type which contains the dimensions for the new control. The CX member contains the Width for the panel, and defaults to 170 pixels. The CY member contains the Height for the panel, and defaults to 50 pixels.

element.name: TCustomPanel.GetControlClassDefaultSize.Result
element.short: TSize value with the default dimensions for new class instances.

element.name: TCustomPanel.Loaded
element.short: Performs actions needed when the component has finished loading in the LCL streaming mechanism.

descr.p: Loaded is an overridden procedure used to perform actions needed when the component has finished loading in the LCL component streaming mechanism. Loaded calls the inherited method, and calls UpdateParentColorChange to adjust the ControlStyle when ParentColor is in use.

element.name: TCustomPanel.RealSetText
element.short: Stores the specified value as the Caption for the control.

descr.p: RealSetText is an overridden procedure used to store the specified value as the Caption for the control. RealSetText calls the inherited method to store the text, and then calls the Invalidate method to repaint the control.

element.name: TCustomPanel.RealSetText.Value
element.short: New text value used as the caption for the control.

element.name: TCustomPanel.Paint
element.short: Paints the panel including the bevels and caption defined for the control.

descr.p: Paint is an overridden procedure which paints the panel including the bevels and caption defined for the control. Paint calls GetClientRect to get the rectangle used to draw the control. PaintBevel is called to draw both the inner and outer bevels for the control (when used).

When Caption contains a String value (other than an empty string), the Canvas for the control is used to render the text. Values in the BiDiMode, WordWrap, and Layout properties are applied to the text as needed.
Paint calls the inherited Paint method prior to exit.

element.name: TCustomPanel.SetParentBackground
element.short: Sets the background used for the parent control.

descr.p: SetParentBackground is an overridden procedure used to the set the background used for the parent control. SetParentBackground ensures that the ControlStyle property is updated to include or omit the value csOpaque. When AParentBackground contains True, the value is excluded from ControlStyle. When AParentBackground contains False, the value is included in ControlStyle.
SetParentBackground calls the inherited method prior to exit.

element.name: TCustomPanel.SetParentBackground.AParentBackground
element.short: When True, the panel is drawn with transparency.

element.name: TCustomPanel.UpdateParentColorChange
element.short: Updates the control to reflect changes to the ParentColor property.

descr.p: UpdateParentColorChange updates the control to reflect changes to the ParentColor property.

When ParentColor is True, the parent color is used, so the value csOpaque is excluded from the ControlStyle property. Otherwise, Parent color is not used, and the value csOpaque is included in the ControlStyle property.

UpdateParentColorChange is called from the Loaded method when the component has finished loading using the LCL component streaming mechanism. It is also called from the CMParentColorChanged method when the change message is handled for the control.

element.name: TCustomPanel.WordWrap
element.short: Indicates if the Caption can be word wrapped when painted.

descr.p: WordWrap is a Boolean property which indicates if the text in the Caption property can be word wrapped into multiple lines when painting the control. The default value for the property is False, and indicates that word wrapping is not used for the caption. Changing the value in WordWrap causes the Invalidate method to be called to repaint the control.
WordWrap is used in the Paint method to initialize properties in the TTextStyle argument used to render the text rectangle for the caption to its Canvas.

element.name: TCustomPanel.Create
element.short: Constructor for the class instance.

descr.p: Create is the constructor for TCustomPanel. It calls the inherited Create method, and sets the initial style, bevel, color, alignment and bounds for the control.

element.name: TCustomPanel.Create.TheOwner
element.short: Owner of the class instance.

element.name: TCustomPanel.Align
element.short: Specifies the placement of the control inside its Parent.

descr.p: Align is a TAlign property which specifies how the control is aligned to its parent control. The default value for the property is alNone.

dl.dd: The control is not aligned. It uses it Top, Left, Height, and Width to place the control in the parent.
Aligns the control to the top of the parent control, and adjusts it Width to fill the parent control.
Aligns the control to the bottom of the parent control, and adjusts its Width to fill the parent control.
Aligns the control to the left edge of the parent control, and adjusts its Height to fill the parent control.
Aligns the control to the right edge of the parent control, and adjusts its Height to fill the parent control.
Aligns the control fill the unused Height and Width for the parent control.
Aligns the control by calling the OnAlignInsertBefore or OnAlignPosition event handlers in the parent control.

element.name: TCustomPanel.Alignment
element.short: Alignment - whether text is left or right justified, or centered.

descr.p: Alignment is a TAlignment property that indicates how the text (or Caption) is aligned on the panel. The default value for the property is taCenter, and causes text to be aligned to the center of the panel. Changing the value in Alignment causes the Invalidate method to be called to repaint the control.

element.name: TCustomPanel.BevelColor
element.short: Color used to draw bevels for the panel.

descr.p: BevelColor is a TColor property that specifies the color used to draw bevels for the panel. BevelColor is used in the PaintBevel method; it is passed as an argument to Canvas drawing routines when BevelColor contains a value other than clDefault.
The default value for the property is clDefault. Changing the value in BevelColor causes the Invalidate to be called to repaint the control.

element.name: TCustomPanel.BevelInner
element.short: BevelInner - determines the nature of the Inner Bevel of the panel (whether raised, lowered etc)

element.name: TCustomPanel.BevelOuter
element.short: BevelOuter - determines the nature of the Outer Bevel of the panel (whether raised, lowered etc)

element.name: TCustomPanel.BevelWidth
element.short: BevelWidth - the Width of the panel's bevel in pixels.

element.name: TCustomPanel.Color
element.short: Contains the background color for the panel.

descr.p: Color is a TColor property with the background color for the panel. It sets the default value for the property.

The default value in Color is the same as the value in the parent window Color property. If the color is clDefault , the result will need to be resolved using the GetDefaultColor method. Convenience routines which obtain the color by resolving clDefault and ParentColor are also provided in TControl.GetColorResolvingParent and TControl.GetRGBColorResolvingParent.

element.name: TCustomPanel.FullRepaint
element.short: FullRepaint - if True, the panel needs to be fully repainted after each change.

descr.p: Exists only for Delphi compatibility; it has no effect in LCL.

element.name: TCustomPanel.ParentBackground
element.short: Indicates if the background from the parent control is used to draw the background for the control.

descr.p: When ParentBackground is True, the control uses the background from the parent color (including any theme drawing features from ThemeServices).

ParentBackground is used in conjunction with the ControlStyle property. Changing the value in ParentBackground causes the ControlStyle property to be updated to reflect the property setting. When the property is set to True, the value csOpaque is excluded from ControlStyle to allow the default background to be drawn. When the property is set to False, the value csOpaque is included in the ControlStyle property.
The default value for the property is True.

element.name: TCustomPanel.ParentColor
element.short: Indicates if the control is drawn using the color in the parent control.

descr.p: When ParentColor is True, the control is drawn using the Color from the parent control. When ParentColor is False, the Color property is used to draw the control.
The default value for the property is True.
Changing the value for the property causes the UpdateParentColorChange method to be executed.

element.name: TPanel
element.short: Implements a general purpose container which can hold other components.

descr.p: TPanel is a TCustomPanel descendant which defines a rectangular area on a form into which components can be placed to group them functionally and geographically. TPanel is a general container for other components, and has a customizable border and caption.

element.name: TFlowStyle
element.short: Represents the flow styles used in TCustomFlowPanel.

descr.p: TFlowStyle is an enumerated type which contains values that represent the flow styles available in TCustomFlowPanel. It is the type used to implement the FlowStyle property in TCustomFlowPanel.

element.name: TFlowStyle.fsLeftRightTopBottom
element.short: Controls flow from left to right, then top to bottom.

element.name: TFlowStyle.fsRightLeftTopBottom
element.short: Controls flow from right to left, then top to bottom.

element.name: TFlowStyle.fsLeftRightBottomTop
element.short: Controls flow from left to right, then bottom to top.

element.name: TFlowStyle.fsRightLeftBottomTop
element.short: Controls flow from right to left, then bottom to top.

element.name: TFlowStyle.fsTopBottomLeftRight
element.short: Controls flow from top to bottom, then left to right.

element.name: TFlowStyle.fsBottomTopLeftRight
element.short: Controls flow from bottom to top, then left to right.

element.name: TFlowStyle.fsTopBottomRightLeft
element.short: Controls flow from top to bottom, then right to left.

element.name: TFlowStyle.fsBottomTopRightLeft
element.short: Controls flow from bottom to top, then right to left.

descr.p: TWrapAfter is an enumerated type with values that specify the wrapping strategy for controls in TCustomFlowPanel.

element.name: TWrapAfter.waAuto
element.short: Automatically wrap when the control exceeds the bounds.

element.name: TWrapAfter.waForce
element.short: Always wrap after this control.

element.name: TWrapAfter.waAvoid
element.short: Try not to wrap after this control, if the control is already at the beginning.

element.name: TWrapAfter.waForbid
element.short: Never wrap after this control.

element.name: TFlowPanelControl
element.short: Implements a collection item for the TFlowPanelControlList collection.

descr.p: TFlowPanelControl is a TCollectionItem descendant which implements a collection item maintained in TFlowPanelControlList. TFlowPanelControl provides properties and methods need to represent a flowed control in the collection, and provides support for the IObjInspInterface used in the Lazarus Object Inspector.

element.name: TFlowPanelControl.SetControl
element.short: Sets the value for the Control property.

element.name: TFlowPanelControl.SetControl.aControl
element.short: New value for the property.

element.name: TFlowPanelControl.SetWrapAfter
element.short: Sets the value for the WrapAfter property.

element.name: TFlowPanelControl.SetWrapAfter.AWrapAfter
element.short: New value for the property.

element.name: TFlowPanelControl.GetDisplayName
element.short: Gets the value for the DisplayName property.

element.name: TFlowPanelControl.GetDisplayName.Result
element.short: Value for the property.

element.name: TFlowPanelControl.SetIndex
element.short: Sets the value for the Index property.

element.name: TFlowPanelControl.AssignTo
element.short: implement persistence in the control.

descr.p: AssignTo is an overridden method used to implement persistence in the control. AssignTo provides support for storing property values from the current class instance into the Dest argument when it is derived from TFlowPanelControl. Otherwise, the inherited AssignTo method is called.

element.name: TFlowPanelControl.AssignTo.Dest
element.short: Persistent object where property values are stored.

element.name: TFlowPanelControl.FPCollection
element.short: Gets the TFlowPanelControlList instance that owns the collection item.

element.name: TFlowPanelControl.FPCollection.Result
element.short: TFlowPanelControlList instance that owns the collection item.

element.name: TFlowPanelControl.FPOwner
element.short: Gets the TCustomFlowPanel instance that owns the collection and its items.

element.name: TFlowPanelControl.FPOwner.Result
element.short: TCustomFlowPanel instance that owns the collection and its items.

element.name: TFlowPanelControl.AllowAdd
element.short: Implements the AllowAdd method from the IObjInspInterface interface.
element.descr: Used by the Lazarus object inspector.

element.name: TFlowPanelControl.AllowDelete
element.short: Implements the AllowDelete method from the IObjInspInterface interface.
element.descr: Used by the Lazarus object inspector.

element.name: TFlowPanelControl.Control
element.short: The associated control to the flow panel control item.
element.descr: Don't set the Control property manually. It is used internally by the designer.

element.name: TFlowPanelControl.WrapAfter
element.short: Determines the wrap policy after this control.

element.name: TFlowPanelControl.Index
element.short: Ordinal position for the flowed control in the TFlowPanelControlList collection.

descr.p: Index is a published property in TFlowPanelControl. Changing the value in Index causes the owner panel to call its ReAlign method when it is not being loaded, updated, or destroyed.

element.name: TFlowPanelControlList
element.short: Implements a collection for TCustomFlowPanel collection items.

descr.p: TFlowPanelControlList is a TOwnedCollection descendant. TFlowPanelControlList implements the IObjInspInterface interface which allows the collection to be used in the Lazarus Object Inspector.

element.name: TFlowPanelControlList.GetItem
element.short: Gets the value for the indexed Items property.

element.name: TFlowPanelControlList.GetItem.Result
element.short: Value for the property.

element.name: TFlowPanelControlList.GetItem.Index
element.short: Ordinal position in the collection for the requested item.

element.name: TFlowPanelControlList.SetItem
element.short: Sets the value for the indexed Items property.

element.name: TFlowPanelControlList.SetItem.Index
element.short: Ordinal position in the collection for the specified item.

element.name: TFlowPanelControlList.SetItem.AItem
element.short: New value for the property.

element.name: TFlowPanelControlList.FPOwner
element.short: Gets the owner of the collection as a TCustomFlowPanel instance.

element.name: TFlowPanelControlList.FPOwner.Result
element.short: The flow panel which owns the collection and its items.

element.name: TFlowPanelControlList.Add
element.short: Adds a TFlowPanelControl instance to the owned collection.

element.name: TFlowPanelControlList.Add.Result
element.short: TFlowPanelControl instance created in the method.

element.name: TFlowPanelControlList.AddControl
element.short: Adds the specified control to the Items for the collection.

element.name: TFlowPanelControlList.AddControl.AControl
element.short: Control to locate and optionally add in the method.

element.name: TFlowPanelControlList.AddControl.AIndex
element.short: Position in Items where the control is stored, or -1 to add the item.

element.name: TFlowPanelControlList.RemoveControl
element.short: Removes the collection item with the specified control.

element.name: TFlowPanelControlList.RemoveControl.AControl
element.short: Control used to locate the collection item deleted in the method.

element.name: TFlowPanelControlList.Create
element.short: Constructor for the class instance.

element.name: TFlowPanelControlList.Create.AOwner
element.short: Owner of the class instance.

element.name: TFlowPanelControlList.IndexOf
element.short: Gets the ordinal position of the specified control in the list of controls.

element.name: TFlowPanelControlList.Items
element.short: Provides indexed access to controls stored in the container.

descr.p: Items is an indexed TFlowPanelControl property which provides access to the flow panel controls in the container. Items is the default property for the collection.
Use the Add or the AddControl method to add a flow panel control to the collection.
Use RemoveControl to remove a flow panel control from the collection.

element.name: TFlowPanelControlList.Items.Index
element.short: Ordinal position for the requested control.

element.name: TFlowPanelControlList.AllowAdd
element.short: Implements the AllowAdd method in the IObjInspInterface interface.

descr.p: Used in the Lazarus object inspector.

element.name: TFlowPanelControlList.AllowDelete
element.short: Implements the AllowDelete method in the IObjInspInterface interface.

descr.p: Used in the Lazarus object inspector.

element.name: TCustomFlowPanel
element.short: The base class for TFlowPanel.

element.name: TCustomFlowPanel.SetAutoWrap
element.short: Sets the value for the AutoWrap property.

element.name: TCustomFlowPanel.SetAutoWrap.AAutoWrap
element.short: New value for the property.

element.name: TCustomFlowPanel.SetControlList
element.short: Sets the value for the ControlList property.

element.name: TCustomFlowPanel.SetControlList.AControlList
element.short: New value for the property.

element.name: TCustomFlowPanel.SetFlowStyle
element.short: Sets the value for the FlowStyle property.

element.name: TCustomFlowPanel.SetFlowStyle.AFlowStyle
element.short: New value for the property.

element.name: TCustomFlowPanel.SetFlowLayout
element.short: Sets the value for the FlowLayout property.

element.name: TCustomFlowPanel.SetFlowLayout.aFlowLayout
element.short: New value for the property.

element.name: TCustomFlowPanel.CMControlChange
element.short: Handles the CM_CONTROLCHANGE message.

descr.p: Calls DisableAlign prior to adding (inserting) the control in ControlList. Calls ReAlign when the control is added, and calls EnableAlign prior to exit.
descr.remark: Please note: The CM_CONTROLCHANGE message is ignored when the component is being loaded using LCL steaming. No actions are performed in the method when csLoading is in the ComponentState property.

element.name: TCustomFlowPanel.CMControlChange.Message
element.short: Message with parameters examined in the method.

element.name: TCustomFlowPanel.AlignControls
element.short: Performs layout and alignment for flowed controls on the panel.

descr.p: AlignControls is an overridden procedure used to perform layout and alignment for flowed controls on the panel.
descr.remark: Please note: AlignControls does NOT call the inherited method.

element.name: TCustomFlowPanel.CalculatePreferredSize
element.descr: CalculatePreferredSize is an overridden procedure used to calculate the preferred height and width for the flow panel. CalculatePreferredSize calls the inherited method.

element.name: TCustomFlowPanel.Create
element.short: Constructor for the class instance.

descr.p: Create is the overridden constructor for the class instance, and calls the inherited constructor. Create ensures that resources are allocated for the ControlList property, and sets the default value for AutoWrap to True.

element.name: TCustomFlowPanel.Create.AOwner
element.short: Owner of the class instance.

element.name: TCustomFlowPanel.Destroy
element.short: Destructor for the class instance.

descr.p: Destroy is the overridden destructor for the class instance. Destroy calls the inherited destructor, and frees resources allocated to the ControlList property.

element.name: TCustomFlowPanel.GetControlIndex
element.short: Gets the ordinal position in ControlList for the specified control.

descr.p: GetControlIndex is a convenience method used to get the ordinal position in ControlList for the specified TFlowPanelControl. Calls TFlowPanelControlList.IndexOf to get the return value, which can be -1 if AControl is not found in ControlList.
Use SetControlIndex to set the ordinal position in ControlList for the specified flowed control.

element.name: TCustomFlowPanel.GetControlIndex.Result
element.short: Position in the control list for the specified control, or -1 when not found.

element.name: TCustomFlowPanel.GetControlIndex.AControl
element.short: Flowed control to locate in ControlList.

element.name: TCustomFlowPanel.SetControlIndex
element.short: Sets the Index position in ControlList for the specified control.

element.name: TCustomFlowPanel.SetControlIndex.AControl
element.short: Control to locate and update in the list of controls.

element.name: TCustomFlowPanel.SetControlIndex.Index
element.short: Value assigned to the Index property for the specified control.

element.name: TCustomFlowPanel.AutoWrap
element.short: Determines if controls in TCustomFlowPanel are wrapped.

element.name: TCustomFlowPanel.ControlList
element.short: Collection used to stored TFlowPanelControl instances on the panel.

element.name: TCustomFlowPanel.FlowStyle
element.short: Contains the flow direction used to position controls on the panel.

element.name: TCustomFlowPanel.FlowLayout
element.short: Use FlowLayout to set the layout (alignment) for the non-flow coordinate. The default value is tlTop.

descr.p: In case of horizontal/vertical flow style: tlTop: top/left alignment in row/column tlCenter: center tlBottom: bottom/right.

element.name: TFlowPanel
element.short: Implements a container with flowed layout for its controls.

descr.p: Use TFloatPanel if you need a container with a float layout. The Anchors and Align properties of child controls are ignored. The floating direction is determined with FlowStyle property.

element.name: TBalloonFlags
element.short: TBalloonFlags enumerated type for flags used in Tray Icon balloons.

descr.p: TBalloonFlags is an enumerated type with values representing flags used in Tray Icon balloon hints. It is the type used to implement the BalloonFlags property in TCustomTrayIcon.

element.name: TBalloonFlags.bfNone
element.short: No icon is displayed on a balloon hint.

element.name: TBalloonFlags.bfInfo
element.short: Displays an Information icon on a balloon hint.

element.name: TBalloonFlags.bfWarning
element.short: Displays a Warning icon on a balloon hint.

element.name: TBalloonFlags.bfError
element.short: Displays an Error icon on a balloon hint.

element.name: TCustomTrayIcon
element.short: Implements the base class for a a multi-platform System Tray component.

descr.p: TCustomTrayIcon is the base class for TTrayIcon, a multi-platform System Tray component.

element.name: TCustomTrayIcon.GetAnimateInterval
element.short: Gets the value for the AnimateInterval property.

element.name: TCustomTrayIcon.GetAnimateInterval.Result
element.short: Value for the property.

element.name: TCustomTrayIcon.GetCanvas
element.short: Gets the value for the Canvas property.

element.name: TCustomTrayIcon.GetCanvas.Result
element.short: Value for the property.

element.name: TCustomTrayIcon.InternalShow
element.short: Prevents the tray icon from being displayed during component streaming.

descr.p: InternalShow is called when the Show method is executed during LCL component streaming. InternalShow sets a flag to enable delayed display when csLoading is in the ComponentState property. No additional actions are performed in the method during LCL component streaming.

The return value contains the result from the Show method in WidgetSetClass. Visible is updated to reflect the state indicated in the widget set class. The value in Animate is used to enable or disable the animation timer for the class instance.

element.name: TCustomTrayIcon.InternalShow.Result
element.short: True when the tray icon is enabled and visible.

element.name: TCustomTrayIcon.SetAnimate
element.short: Sets the value for the Animate property.

element.name: TCustomTrayIcon.SetAnimate.AValue
element.short: New value for the property.

element.name: TCustomTrayIcon.SetAnimateInterval
element.short: Sets the value for the AnimateInterval property.

element.name: TCustomTrayIcon.SetAnimateInterval.AValue
element.short: New value for the property.

element.name: TCustomTrayIcon.SetHint
element.short: Sets the value for the Hint property.

element.name: TCustomTrayIcon.SetHint.AValue
element.short: New value for the property.

element.name: TCustomTrayIcon.SetIcon
element.short: Sets the value for the Icon property.

element.name: TCustomTrayIcon.SetIcon.AValue
element.short: New value for the property.

element.name: TCustomTrayIcon.SetIcons
element.short: Sets the value for the Icons property.

element.name: TCustomTrayIcon.SetIcons.AValue
element.short: New value for the property.

element.name: TCustomTrayIcon.SetPopUpMenu
element.short: Sets the value for the PopupMenu property.

element.name: TCustomTrayIcon.SetPopUpMenu.AValue
element.short: New value for the property.

element.name: TCustomTrayIcon.SetVisible
element.short: Sets the value for the Visible property.

element.name: TCustomTrayIcon.SetVisible.Value
element.short: New value for the property.

element.name: TCustomTrayIcon.HandleNotifierClose
element.short: Performs actions needed when the popup notifier is closed.

descr.p: HandleNotifierClose ensures that the internal balloon hint timer for the tray icon is disabled when the notifier is closed or destroyed. HandleNotifierClose is assigned to the OnClose event handler in the internal TPopupNotifier class instance used in the tray icon.

element.name: TCustomTrayIcon.HandleNotifierClose.Sender
element.short: Object instance for the event notification.

element.name: TCustomTrayIcon.HandleNotifierClose.CloseAction
element.short: Action to perform; not used in the method.

element.name: TCustomTrayIcon.HandleNotifierTimeout
element.short: Event handler used when the timer in the tray icon has expired.

descr.p: HandleNotifierTimeout is a procedure which implements an event handler used to disabled the timer and to close the popup notifier for the tray icon. HandleNotifierTimeout is used as the OnTimer event handler in the TTimer class instance used in the component.

element.name: TCustomTrayIcon.HandleNotifierTimeout.Sender
element.short: Object instance for the event notification.

element.name: TCustomTrayIcon.HandleOnAnimateTimer
element.short: Event handler used when the interval for the animation timer has elapsed.

descr.p: HandleOnAnimateTimer is a procedure used to implement an event handler signalled when the interval for the animation timer has elapsed. HandleOnAnimateTimer retrieves and displays a bitmap stored in the Icons property when the interval for the timer has elapsed. An internal counter is incremented in the handler to indicate the next image used in the animation sequence. The counter is reset to zero (0) when the last bitmap in Icons is used. HandleOnAnimateTimer calls the InternalUpdate method to refresh the widget set class for the tray icon.
HandleOnAnimateTimer is assigned to the OnTImer event handler for the internal TTimer instance used as the animation timer.
Use Animate to control whether animations are displayed for the tray icon.
Use AnimateInterval to specify the number of elapsed milliseconds allowed before the event handler in the animation timer is signalled.

element.name: TCustomTrayIcon.HandleOnAnimateTimer.Sender
element.short: Object instance for the event notification.

element.name: TCustomTrayIcon.IconChanged
element.short: Implements an event handler signalled when the Icon is changed for the component.

descr.p: IconChanged is a procedure which implements an event handler signalled when the Icon is changed for the component. IconChanged ensures that the WidgetSetClass is notified of the change to the tray icon.
descr.remark: Please note: No actions are performed in the event handler if a Handle has already been assigned (contains a non-zero value) for the component.
descr.p: IconChanged is assigned as the OnChange event handler for the Icon property in the constructor for the class instance.

element.name: TCustomTrayIcon.IconChanged.Sender
element.short: Object instance for the event notification.

element.name: TCustomTrayIcon.Notification
element.short: Performs action when a component is added or removed at run-time.

descr.p: Notification is an overridden procedure used to perform actions when a component is added or removed at run-time. Notification calls the inherited method, and ensures that the PopUpMenu for the tray icon is set to Nil when the component is removed.

element.name: TCustomTrayIcon.Notification.AComponent
element.short: Component for the notification.

element.name: TCustomTrayIcon.Notification.Operation
element.short: Operation for the notification.

element.name: TCustomTrayIcon.Loaded
element.short: Performs actions needed when the component has finished loading from the LCL streaming mechanism.

descr.p: Loaded is an overridden procedure used to perform actions needed when the component has finished loading from the LCL streaming mechanism. Loaded calls the inherited method, and calls the InternalShow method to display the tray icon.

element.name: TCustomTrayIcon.Handle
element.short: Operating system Handle for the Tray Icon.

descr.p: Handle is a public HWND member that represents the operating system handle for the control. The value in Handle is used (when assigned) in the IconChanged event handler.

element.name: TCustomTrayIcon.Create
element.short: Create - constructor for TCustomTrayIcon: performs inherited Create then creates icon, timer and initializes balloon timeout.

descr.p: Create creates a new instance of a TCustomTrayIcon class. If AOwner is not Nil, the new component attempts to insert itself in the list of owned components of the owner.

element.name: TCustomTrayIcon.Destroy
element.short: Destroy - destructor for TCustomTrayIcon: frees icon and timer then calls inherited Destroy.

descr.p: Destroy sends a opRemove notification to all components in the free-notification list. After that, all owned components are destroyed by calling DestroyComponents (and hence removed from the list of owned components). When this is done, the component removes itself from its owner's child component list. After that, the parent's destroy method is called.

element.name: TCustomTrayIcon.Hide
element.short: Hide removes the icon from the System Tray.

descr.p: Hide is a Boolean function used to hide the tray icon and to remove it from the tray area in the task bar.
descr.remark: Please note: No actions are performed in the method when Visible is set to False, or at design-time, or when the component is loaded from the LCL streaming mechanism.
descr.p: Hide sets the value in the Visible property to False, and calls the namesake method in the WidgetSetClass. The internal animation timer for the tray icon is also disabled in the method.
The return value is True when the tray icon is successfully hidden. For other conditions, the return value is False.

element.name: TCustomTrayIcon.Show
element.short: Show displays the icon in the System Tray.

descr.p: Show is a Boolean function used to display the tray icon in the system tray. The return value is True if the control is successfully displayed in the method, or the control is already visible. No additional actions are performed in the method when Visible is already set to True.
The return value is always False at design-time. At run-time, the InternalShow method is called to display the control with delayed loading and to set the sate for the internal animation timer.

element.name: TCustomTrayIcon.InternalUpdate
element.short: InternalUpdate - updates any pending changes.

descr.p: The behavior of this method depends on the widgetset.It was added to provide a way to update items which either cannot be updated automatically when changed, or would be too inefficient to be updated on each change.

One example of this is the tray icon menu under LCL-Carbon. It is not automatically updated when changes are made to it's associated LCL TPopUpMenu, but changes are updated when InternalUpdate is called. This happens because the tray icon menus are Cocoa menus which don't match the Carbon menus from LCL-Carbon.

Similar things happen in other widgetsets, so InternalUpdate can be expected to update the menu and/or icon of the tray icon, if this is necessary. If such an update is not required, for example because it is automatically updated on each change, then InternalUpdate will simply do nothing, so it is always a safe function to call, regardless of the widgetset.

element.name: TCustomTrayIcon.ShowBalloonHint
element.short: Displays a balloon-like window near the tray icon.

descr.p: ShowBalloonHint displays a small balloon-like window near the tray icon. It can be used to send notifications about the status of an action, or notify of a received message or any other event which doesn't require an immediate response. The Balloon window disappears after the BallonHintTimeout interval has elapsed, or when the user clicks on the close button for the balloon hint.

element.name: TCustomTrayIcon.GetPosition
element.short: Gets the position for the tray icon on the display.

descr.p: GetPosition is a TPoint function used to get the position of the tray icon on the display. GetPosition calls the namesake method in the WidgetSetClass to get the location for the tray icon. The coordinates in the return value are used to determine the location for a BalloonHint window for the tray icon.
For the Windows platform, an approximate location in the tray area in the Windows taskbar is used.

element.name: TCustomTrayIcon.Animate
element.short: Indicates if animations are displayed on the tray icon.

descr.p: Animate is a Boolean property that indicates if animations are displayed on the tray icon.
The default value for the property is False. Sets Animate to True to enable the animation timer using the interval in AnimateInterval, and start the animation sequence stored in the Icons property.

element.name: TCustomTrayIcon.AnimateInterval
element.short: Defines the time interval between updates to the image for the tray icon.

descr.p: AnimateInterval is a Cardinal property that defines the elapsed time interval between updates to the image displayed on the tray icon. The default value for the property is 1000 (milliseconds), and causes the animation timer to refresh the image on the tray icon every second.
Update the Icons property to contain the bitmaps displayed in the animation sequence,
Set Animate to True to enable the animation timer for the tray icon.

element.name: TCustomTrayIcon.BalloonFlags
element.short: Defines the balloon flag displayed for the tray icon balloon hint.

descr.p: BalloonFlags is a TBalloonFlags property which defines the balloon flag displayed for the tray icon balloon hint. BalloonFlags are used when the widget set class displays the balloon hint window for the tray icon. The default value for the property is bfNone. See for more information about the values in the enumeration and their meanings.

element.name: TCustomTrayIcon.BalloonHint
element.short: The text to be shown in the hinting balloon.

element.name: TCustomTrayIcon.BalloonTimeout
element.short: The period after which the hinting balloon disappears.

element.name: TCustomTrayIcon.BalloonTitle
element.short: The title to be shown on the hinting balloon.

element.name: TCustomTrayIcon.Canvas
element.short: The canvas of the Tray Icon.

element.name: TCustomTrayIcon.PopUpMenu
element.short: PopUpMenu is a popup menu which is displayed when right mouse button is clicked over the icon, separate from the balloon hint window.

element.name: TCustomTrayIcon.Icon
element.short: The Icon or picture that displayed on the tray icon.

element.name: TCustomTrayIcon.Icons
element.short: Image list with the bitmaps used for an animated icon.

descr.p: Icons is a TCustomImageList property with the bitmap images displayed for an animated icon. Icons is used when the Animate property is set to True.

Setting a new value for the property causes the widgetset class to be updated when the control is Visible. The current animation step (or frame) is reset to 0 to prevent an index out-of-bounds exception.
Use Icon to set the single image displayed on the tray icon when Animate is set to False.

element.name: TCustomTrayIcon.Hint
element.short: A simple hint shown when the mouse hovers over the icon.

element.name: TCustomTrayIcon.ShowIcon
element.short: Determines if Icon should be painted to the System Tray. This can be set to false if one wishes to instead paint to the Canvas of the Tray Icon.

element.name: TCustomTrayIcon.Visible
element.short: It is set to true when the icon is shown and remains true until Hide is called. Setting Visible has the same effect as calling Hide or Show.

element.name: TCustomTrayIcon.OnClick
element.short: Event Handler for Mouse Click on Tray Icon.

element.name: TCustomTrayIcon.OnDblClick
element.short: Event handler for mouse double-click.

element.name: TCustomTrayIcon.OnMouseDown
element.short: Event handler if mouse button is pressed down.

element.name: TCustomTrayIcon.OnMouseUp
element.short: Event handler if mouse button is up.

element.name: TCustomTrayIcon.OnMouseMove
element.short: Event handler for mouse movement.

element.name: TCustomTrayIcon.OnPaint
element.short: Event handler used to implement custom drawing for the tray icon.

descr.p: OnPaint is an event handler used to implement custom drawing for the tray icon. Draw using the canvas property for the tray icon.
descr.remark: Please note: OnPaint does not work on the Win32 platform.

element.name: TTrayIcon
element.short: Implements a multi-platform System Tray component.

descr.p: TTrayIcon is a TCustomTrayIcon descendant which implements a multi-platform System Tray component. It adds an icon to the tray which signifies an application that is inactive but ready to be activated.

On the Windows platform, the System tray is usually located on the bottom-right corner of the screen, but it ban be located on other edges for the physical screen. For other operating systems, this position varies according to the window or display manager in use.
TTrayIcon sets the visibility for properties defined in the ancestor class.
TBandDrawingStyle is an enumeration type with values representing the drawing styles available for tool bar bands.

element.name: TBandPaintOption
element.short: Represents the paint options enabled when drawing a TControlBar.

descr.p: TBandPaintOption is an enumerated type with values that represent the paint options enabled when drawing a TControlBar instance. Values from TBandPaintOption are stored in the TBandPaintOptions type, and passed as an argument to a TBandPaintEvent event handler.

element.name: TBandPaintOptions
element.short: Stores values from the TBandPaintOption enumeration.

element.name: TBandDragEvent
element.short: Specifies an event handler signalled when a control band is dragged.

element.name: TBandInfoEvent
element.short: Specifies an event handler used to get layout and positioning information for control bands.

element.name: TBandMoveEvent
element.short: Specifies an event handler signalled when a control band is moved.

element.name: TBandMoveEvent.Sender
element.short: Object instance for the event notification.

element.name: TBandMoveEvent.Control
element.short: Control for the event notification.

element.name: TBandMoveEvent.ARect
element.short: Display rectangle for the event notification.

element.name: TBandPaintEvent
element.short: Specifies an event handler used to perform actions needed when a band in TCustomControlBar is painted.

descr.p: TBandPaintEvent specifies an object procedure used to perform actions needed when a band in TCustomControlBar control is painted. TBandPaintEvent is the type used to implement the OnBandPaint event handler in TCustomControlBar.

Arguments passed to the procedure identify the TCustomControlBar drawn in the band, and the Canvas and drawing rectangle used in the drawing operation. Options define the drawing features enabled for the band.
TRowSize a range type which defines the range of values available for the RowSize property in TCustomControlBar. Essentially, any positive non-zero Integer value.

element.name: TBandMove
element.short: Represents band move states in TCtrlBand.

element.name: TCursorDesign
element.short: Represents cursor shapes displayed when the mouse hovers over different an area in a control band.

element.name: TCtrlBand
element.short: Represents a band and control displayed by TControlBar.

descr.p: TCtrlBand is a class used to represent a band displayed on TCustomControlBar / TControlBar. It provides properties needed for the Control drawn on the band, its visibility, and position and size information.
TCtrlBand is the type created and stored in the TCtrlBands container.

element.name: TCtrlBand.GetBandRect
element.short: Gets the value for the BandRect property.

element.name: TCtrlBand.GetBandRect.Result
element.short: Value for the property.

element.name: TCtrlBand.GetBottom
element.short: Gets the value for the Bottom property.

element.name: TCtrlBand.GetBottom.Result
element.short: Value for the property.

element.name: TCtrlBand.GetRight
element.short: Gets the value for the Right property.

element.name: TCtrlBand.GetRight.Result
element.short: Value for the property.

element.name: TCtrlBand.SetBandRect
element.short: Sets the value for the BandRect property.

element.name: TCtrlBand.SetBandRect.AValue
element.short: New value for the property.

element.name: TCtrlBand.SetRight
element.short: Sets the value for the Right property.

element.name: TCtrlBand.SetRight.AValue
element.short: New value for the property.

element.name: TCtrlBand.BandRect
element.short: Contains the bounds for the band control.

descr.p: BandRect is a TRect property which contains the bounds for the band control. BandRect is used in methods which set the layout and placement for the the band control, like InitializeBand and MoveBand.

Values in BandRect are read from the Left, Right, Width, and Height properties in the control. When setting the value for the property, the Left, Right, Width, and Height properties are updated using the values provided in the rectangle.

element.name: TCtrlBand.Bottom
element.short: Position of the bottom of the band control.
element.descr: Bottom is a read-only Integer property which contains the vertical position that is the bottom of the band control. The value in Bottom is derived using the Top and Height properties, which are updated when a value is assigned to the BandRect property.

element.name: TCtrlBand.Control
element.short: Contains the control displayed on the band.

descr.p: Control is a TControl property which contains the TToolBar or TToolButton displayed in the band control. The value in Control is assigned in either the Loaded or the InsertControl methods in TCustomControlBar.

element.name: TCtrlBand.ControlHeight
element.short: Stored Height for the Control used during resizing.

descr.p: ControlHeight is an Integer property which represents the height for the TWinControl in the Control property. The value in ControlHeight is assigned when a TCustomControlBar is aligned to the band control.

element.name: TCtrlBand.ControlLeft
element.short: Stored Left position for the Control used in comparisons during resizing.
element.descr: The value is updated in the AlignControlToBand method in TCustomControlBar, and provides convenient access to the property value in Control.

element.name: TCtrlBand.ControlTop
element.short: Stored Top position for the Control used in comparisons during resizing.

descr.p: The value is updated in the AlignControlToBand method in TCustomControlBar, and provides convenient access to the property value in Control.

element.name: TCtrlBand.ControlWidth
element.short: Stored Width for the Control used in comparisons during resizing.

descr.p: The value is updated in the AlignControlToBand method in TCustomControlBar, and provides convenient access to the property value in Control.

element.name: TCtrlBand.ControlVisible
element.short: Stores the visibility for the Control.

descr.p: Updated and used in the CheckBandsSizeAndVisibility method in TCustomControlBar.

element.name: TCtrlBand.Height
element.short: Stored Height for the band used in comparisons during resizing.

descr.p: The value is updated in the AlignControlToBand method in TCustomControlBar, and provides convenient access to the property value in Control.

element.name: TCtrlBand.InitLeft
element.short: Stores the initial Left position for the band during a move operation.

descr.p: Updated in the InitializeMove method in TCustomControlBar.

element.name: TCtrlBand.InitTop
element.short: Stores the initial Top position for the band during a move operation.

descr.p: Updated in the InitializeMove method in TCustomControlBar.

element.name: TCtrlBand.Left
element.short: Contains the Left position for the band.

descr.p: Updated when a value is assigned to the BandRect property, and in the AlignControlToBand method in TCustomControlBar.

element.name: TCtrlBand.Right
element.short: Contains the Right position for the band.

descr.p: Updated when a value is assigned to the BandRect property, and in the AlignControlToBand method in TCustomControlBar.

element.name: TCtrlBand.Top
element.short: Contains the Top position for the band.

descr.p: Updated when a value is assigned to the BandRect property, and in the AlignControlToBand method in TCustomControlBar.

element.name: TCtrlBand.Visible
element.short: Indicates if the band and its Control are visible.

element.name: TCtrlBand.Width
element.short: Contains the dimensions for the band.

descr.p: Updated when a value is assigned to the BandRect property, and in the AlignControlToBand method in TCustomControlBar.

element.name: TCtrlBands
element.short: Container used to store TCtrlBand instances.

descr.p: TCtrlBands is a container for TCtrlBand instances. TCtrlBands provides a GetIndex method used to access TCtrlBand items stored in the container by their ordinal positions.

element.name: TCtrlBands.GetIndex
element.short: Gets the ordinal position for the specified control in the container.

element.name: TCtrlBands.GetIndex.Result
element.short: Ordinal position for the requested control, or -1 when not found in the container.

element.name: TCtrlBands.GetIndex.AControl
element.short: The control to locate in the TCtrlBand items in the container.

element.name: TCustomControlBar
element.short: Implements a panel used to maintain and manage tool bars and tool buttons on a form.

descr.p: TCustomControlBar is a TCustomPanel descendant used to maintain and manage tool bars and tool buttons added to the container.

Internally, it uses a TCtrlBands member to represent the TToolBar, TToolButton, or TCoolBar classes added to the container. Use InsertControl and RemoveControl to maintain items in the container at run-time, or use the design-time support provided in the Lazarus Form Designer.

element.name: TCustomControlBar.SetDrawingStyle
element.short: Sets the value for the DrawingStyle property.

element.name: TCustomControlBar.SetDrawingStyle.AValue
element.short: New value for the property.

element.name: TCustomControlBar.SetGradientDirection
element.short: Sets the value for the GradientDirection property.

element.name: TCustomControlBar.SetGradientDirection.AValue
element.short: New value for the property.

element.name: TCustomControlBar.SetGradientEndColor
element.short: Sets the value for the GradientEndColor property.

element.name: TCustomControlBar.SetGradientEndColor.AValue
element.short: New value for the property.

element.name: TCustomControlBar.SetGradientStartColor
element.short: Sets the value for the GradientStartColor property.

element.name: TCustomControlBar.SetGradientStartColor.AValue
element.short: New value for the property.

element.name: TCustomControlBar.SetPicture
element.short: Sets the value for the Picture property.

element.name: TCustomControlBar.SetPicture.aValue
element.short: New value for the property.

element.name: TCustomControlBar.SetRowSize
element.short: Sets the value for the RowSize property.

element.name: TCustomControlBar.SetRowSize.AValue
element.short: New value for the property.

element.name: TCustomControlBar.cBandBorderH
element.short: Space reserved for the horizontal border in a control bar.

element.name: TCustomControlBar.cBandBorderV
element.short: Space reserved for the vertical border in a control bar

element.name: TCustomControlBar.cGrabWidth
element.short: Space reserved as the width of the grabber in a control bar.

element.name: TCustomControlBar.cFullGrabber
element.short: Space needed for the width of the grabber including the control bar and its border.

element.name: TCustomControlBar.FBands
element.short: Member with the list of TCtrlBand instances for the control bar.

element.name: TCustomControlBar.FBandMove
element.short: Member with the band move status flag for the control bar.

element.name: TCustomControlBar.FCursorLock
element.short: Member with the cursor lock flag set when ChangeCursor is called.

element.name: TCustomControlBar.FDefCursor
element.short: Member with the default cursor shape for the control bar.

element.name: TCustomControlBar.FHoveredBand
element.short: Member with the band under the mouse cursor during a drag operation.

element.name: TCustomControlBar.FInitDrag
element.short: Member with the initial coordinates for the band being dragged on the control bar.

element.name: TCustomControlBar.FInnerBevelWidth
element.short: Member with the width for inner bevels following a CM_BORDERCHANGED control message.

element.name: TCustomControlBar.FLockResize
element.short: Member with a flag set to prevent resizing while the row size is updated for the control bar.

element.name: TCustomControlBar.FPrevWidth
element.short: Member with the Width for the control bar after its Handle is created.

element.name: TCustomControlBar.FVisiBands
element.short: Member with the visible bands for the control bar.

element.name: TCustomControlBar.FVisiBandsEx
element.short: Member with the visible bands on the control bar excluding a band being dragged.

element.name: TCustomControlBar.AlignControlToBand
element.short: Aligns the control bar to the specified control band.

element.name: TCustomControlBar.AlignControlsToBands
element.short: Aligns visible control bands in the container.
element.descr: Temporarily disables AutoSizing during the alignment process. Restores AutoSizing prior to exiting from the method.

element.name: TCustomControlBar.CalcBandHeight
element.short: Calculates the vertical space needed for the control bar.

element.name: TCustomControlBar.CalcBandHeight.Result
element.short: Number of pixels need for the height of the control bar.

element.name: TCustomControlBar.CalcBandHeight.AControl
element.short: Toolbar or Toolbutton control examined in the method.

element.name: TCustomControlBar.CalcBandHeightSnapped
element.short: Calculates the vertical space needed for the control bar when RowSnap is enabled.

element.name: TCustomControlBar.CalcInnerBevelWidth
element.short: Calculates the cumulative width for all borders and bevels used on the control bar.

element.name: TCustomControlBar.CalcLowestBandBottomPx
element.short: Gets the largest value in the Bottom property for visible bands on the control bar.

element.name: TCustomControlBar.ChangeCursor
element.short: Changes the cursor to the specified shape.

descr.p: ACursor contains the cursor shape requested in the method. The value in ACursor is translated into one the following cursor constants, and assigned to the Cursor property:

dl.dd: Uses the default Cursor for the control.
Uses the crDrag cursor constant as the cursor shape.
Uses the crNo cursor constant as the cursor shape.

element.name: TCustomControlBar.ChangeCursor.ACursor
element.short: Cursor shape requested in the method.

element.name: TCustomControlBar.CheckBandsSizeAndVisibility
element.short: Updates the size and visibility for TCtrlBand instances defined in the control bar.

descr.p: Calls InitializeBand (when needed) for a TCtrlBand with a visibility different than the value in the control bar. Calls SortVisibleBands when a TCtrlBand is hidden. Calls NormalizeRows to display TCtrlBand instances in the order defined by their Bottom property. Recalculates the positions and dimensions for visible TCtrlBand instances, including the space reserved for the Grabber bar and borders.

element.name: TCustomControlBar.CMBiDiModeChanged
element.short: Handles the CM_BIDIMODECHANGED message.

element.name: TCustomControlBar.CMBorderChanged
element.short: Handles the CM_BORDERCHANGED message.

element.name: TCustomControlBar.CreateWnd
element.short: Ensures the default cursor and width values are assigned when the window handle is created.

element.name: TCustomControlBar.DoBandMove
element.short: Signals the OnBandMove event handler for the specified control and drawing rectangle.

element.name: TCustomControlBar.DoBandPaint
element.short: Signals the OnBandPaint event handler using the arguments to the method.

element.name: TCustomControlBar.DragControl
element.short: Signals an assigned OnBandDrag event handler and starts a drag operation.

element.name: TCustomControlBar.GetControlInfo
element.short: Signals the OnBandInfo event handler to store control information in the arguments to the method.

element.name: TCustomControlBar.InitializeClass
element.short: Class constructor used to initial class constants.

element.name: TCustomControlBar.InitializeBand
element.short: Configures a band and calculates its row position, order, and geometry including client decorations.

element.name: TCustomControlBar.InitializeMove
element.short: Prepares visible bands on the control bar for a drag and drop operation.

element.name: TCustomControlBar.Loaded
element.short: Performs actions needed when component loading has been completed.

element.name: TCustomControlBar.IsBandOverlap
element.short: Determines if the display rectangles for two bands overlap.

element.name: TCustomControlBar.IsBandOverlap.Result
element.short: True when the rectangles overlap horizontally or vertically.

element.name: TCustomControlBar.MouseDown
element.short: Handles a mouse down message in the control.

descr.p: Overridden to provide support for dragging the control band under the mouse cursor.

element.name: TCustomControlBar.MouseMove
element.short: Handles a mouse move message while dragging a control band.

element.name: TCustomControlBar.MouseUp
element.short: Handles a mouse up message that ends a drag operation for a control band.

element.name: TCustomControlBar.MoveBand
element.short: Determines the new position for a band moved using the mouse or by settings its coordinates, and rearranges adjacent bands (and rows) as needed.

element.name: TCustomControlBar.NormalizeRows
element.short: Orders visible bands in the control, and removes empty rows.

element.name: TCustomControlBar.Paint
element.short: Draws the control with its image, decorations, and visible bands.

element.name: TCustomControlBar.PictureChanged
element.short: Redraws the control bar when the internal update counter reaches 0.

descr.p: Assigned as the OnChange event handler for the Picture property.

element.name: TCustomControlBar.Resize
element.short: Signals the OnResize event handler (when assigned) and re-aligns bands and their controls when needed.

element.name: TCustomControlBar.SetCursor
element.short: Sets the Cursor to the specified TCursor shape.

descr.p: SetCursor is an overridden method in TCustomControlBar used to set the cursor to the specified cursor shape. It calls the inherited method on entry to perform the CM_CURSORCHANGED control message for the control. This triggers the ChangeCursor method which applies the cursor shape in Value. Value is also stored in the FDefCursor member as the default cursor shape.

element.name: TCustomControlBar.SetCursor.Value
element.short: TCursor shape

element.name: TCustomControlBar.ShiftBands
element.short: Shifts the position for the specified range of bands by the specified amount and limit.

element.name: TCustomControlBar.SortVisibleBands
element.short: Calculates the number of visible bands (and controls) and optionally sorts bands to reflect their coordinates.

element.name: TCustomControlBar.WMSize
element.short: Handles the LM_SIZE message.

descr.p: Overridden to resize and arrange visible bands on the control when the size for the control bar is changed.

element.name: TCustomControlBar.WMSize.Message
element.short: Window message handled in the method.

element.name: TCustomControlBar.FUpdateCount
element.short: Member with the update counter for the control bar.

element.name: TCustomControlBar.Create
element.short: Constructor for the class instance.

descr.p: Create is the overridden constructor for the class instance. Create allocates resources needed to store the bands for the control bar, and calls the inherited constructor. Creates sets the default values for properties, including:
Resources are allocated for the Picture property, and its OnChange event handler is set to the PictureChanged method.
Creates set the initial bounds for the class instance using a width of 100 pixels, and a height of 50 pixels.

element.name: TCustomControlBar.Create.AOwner
element.short: Owner of the class instance.

element.name: TCustomControlBar.Destroy
element.short: Destructor for the class instance.

descr.p: Destroy is the overridden destructor for the class instance. Destroy frees resources allocated to the Picture property, as well as the internal TCtrlBands container. Destroy calls the inherited destructor prior to exit.

element.name: TCustomControlBar.BeginUpdate
element.short: Increments the internal counter used to track the number of active update requests.

element.name: TCustomControlBar.EndUpdate
element.short: Decrements the internal counter used to track update requests, and calls Invalidate when the counter is zero (0)

element.name: TCustomControlBar.FlipChildren
element.short: Flips the horizontal display order for child controls.

descr.remark: FlipChildren is an empty implementation in TCustomControlBar.

element.name: TCustomControlBar.FlipChildren.AllLevels
element.short: True all descendent controls are flipped as well.

element.name: TCustomControlBar.HitTest
element.short: Gets the visible control for a band under the specified coordinates.

element.name: TCustomControlBar.HitTest.Result
element.short: The tool bar or tool button in the band at the specified position, or Nil when a visible control is not found.

element.name: TCustomControlBar.HitTest.X
element.short: Horizontal position for the test.

element.name: TCustomControlBar.HitTest.Y
element.short: Vertical position for the test.

element.name: TCustomControlBar.InsertControl
element.short: Creates and stores a new band for the specified control.

descr.p: InsertControl is an overridden procedure used to create, initialize, and store a TCtrlBand for the specified control. InsertControl calls the method inherited from TWinControl, and creates and stores a new TCtrlBand instance for the control in AControl.

element.name: TCustomControlBar.InsertControl.AControl
element.short: Tool bar or tool button added to the new band in the control bar.

element.name: TCustomControlBar.InsertControl.Index
element.short: Ordinal position in the bands where the control is inserted.

element.name: TCustomControlBar.MouseToBandPos
element.short: Finds the band on the control bar which contains the specified mouse coordinates.

element.name: TCustomControlBar.RemoveControl
element.short: Removes the band for the specified control.

element.name: TCustomControlBar.RemoveControl.AControl
element.short: Tool bar or tool button removed from the bands in the control bar.

element.name: TCustomControlBar.StickControls
element.short: Aligns control to the bands in the control bar.

element.name: TCustomControlBar.AutoDock
element.short: Not used in the current LCL implementation.

descr.p: The default value for the property is True.
descr.remark: Not used in the current LCL implementation.

element.name: TCustomControlBar.AutoDrag
element.short: Indicates if the control allows a band to be dragged even when DragManager is not used.

descr.p: Indicates if the control can call DragControl to move a band on the control using the mouse. The default value for the property is True.
Called from the MouseMove method when DragManager does not handle the request.

element.name: TCustomControlBar.AutoSize
element.short: Indicates if bands are automatically sized and positioned for the control bar.

descr.p: When AutoSize is False, the CheckBandsSizeAndVisibility method is called to Resize the bands in the control bar. When set to False, the inherited method is used. In addition, AutoSize determines if InvalidatePreferredSize is used when setting the value for the RowSize property.

element.name: TCustomControlBar.DrawingStyle
element.short: Fill style used for bands on the control bar.

descr.p: DrawingStyle is a TBandDrawingStyle property which indicates the fill style applied to the control bar. The default value for the property is dsNormal. Set DrawingStyle to dsGradient to draw the control bar using a gradient defined by the values in GradientDirection, GradientStartColor, and GradientEndColor.

element.name: TCustomControlBar.GradientDirection
element.short: Controls the direction for a gradient drawn on the control bar.

descr.p: GradientDirection is a TGradientDirection property which controls the direction for a gradient drawn on the control bar. The default value for the property is gdVertical. Changing the value for the property causes the Invalidate method to be performed when BeginUpdate has not yet been called.
GradientDirection is used when the DrawingStyle property contains the value dsGradient. Set the values in GradientStartColor and GradientEndColor to define the colors used to draw the gradient.

element.name: TCustomControlBar.GradientStartColor
element.short: Specifies the initial color used in a gradient drawn on the control bar.

element.name: TCustomControlBar.GradientEndColor
element.short: Specifies the ending color used in a gradient drawn on the control bar.

element.name: TCustomControlBar.Picture
element.short: Optional image drawn before the visible bands for the control bar.

descr.p: Picture is a TPicture property which contains an optional image drawn on the client rectangle for the control bar. The image is tiled to fill the client area (if needed) immediately prior to drawing the visible bands for the control bar.
Picture is used in the Paint method.
PictureChanged is assigned as the OnChange event handler for the Picture property in the constructor for the class.

element.name: TCustomControlBar.RowSize
element.short: Height used for a band or a row of bands displayed on the control bar.

descr.p: RowSize is a TRowSize property which specifies the height for a row or band displayed on the control bar. The default value for the property is 26.
Changing the value in the property causes the bands for the control bar to be resized and realigned. The Invalidate method will be called to repaint the control if BeginUpdate is not already active.

element.name: TCustomControlBar.RowSnap
element.short: Indicates if a band or row of bands snaps to the height for the control bar.

descr.p: RowSnap is a Boolean property which indicates if a band or row of bands snaps to the height for the control bar. The default value for the property is True. When set to False, each band on the control bar calcuates its own height and allocates additional space for bevels.
Used in the CalcBandHeight method, and when a new value is assigned to the RowSize property.

element.name: TCustomControlBar.OnBandDrag
element.short: Event handler signalled when a control band is dropped in the control bar.

element.name: TCustomControlBar.OnBandInfo
element.short: Event handler signalled to get the insets rectangles, preferred size, and row count for the control bar.

descr.p: OnBandInfo is a TBandInfoEvent property with the event handler signalled to get the insets rectangles, preferred size, and row count for the control bar. Called from the GetControlInfo method (if assigned) when a new control is added to the control bar.

element.name: TCustomControlBar.OnBandMove
element.short: Event handler signalled when a control band is moved on the control bar.

element.name: TCustomControlBar.OnBandPaint
element.short: Event handler signalled to render a visible band with the specified control and paint options.

descr.p: OnBandPaint is a TBandPaintEvent property with the event handler signalled to render a band with the specified control and paint options. OnBandPaint is signalled from the DoBandPaint method, and occurs when the Paint method draws each of the visible bands for the control bar.

element.name: TCustomControlBar.OnCanResize
element.short: Not used in the current implementation of TCustomControlBar / TControlBar.

descr.remark: Not used in the current implementation of TCustomControlBar / TControlBar.

element.name: TCustomControlBar.OnPaint
element.short: Event handler signalled to perform default drawing in the ancestor class.

element.name: TControlBar
